name: bulbasaur
bio: While it is young, it uses the nutrients that are stored in the seed on its back in order to grow.

name: ivysaur
bio: Exposure to sunlight adds to its strength. Sunlight also makes the bud on its back grow larger.

name: venusaur
bio: Huge amounts of pollen burst from it with the force of a volcanic eruption. Breathing in too much of the pollen can cause fainting.

name: charmander
bio: From the time it is born, a flame burns at the tip of its tail. Its life would end if the flame were to go out.

name: charmeleon
bio: If it becomes agitated during battle, it spouts intense flames, incinerating its surroundings

name: charizard
bio: The flame inside its body burns hotter than 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit. When Charizard roars, that temperature climbs even higher.

name: squirtle
bio: When it feels threatened, it draws its limbs inside its shell and sprays water from its mouth.

name: wartortle
bio: It cleverly controls its furry ears and tail to maintain its balance while swimming.

name: blastoise
bio: Water fired from this Pokémon's central main cannon has enough power to blast a hole into a mountain.

name: caterpie
bio: Its short feet are tipped with suction pads that enable it to tirelessly climb slopes and walls.

name: metapod
bio: Even though it is encased in a sturdy shell, the body inside is tender. It can't withstand a harsh attack.

name: butterfree
bio: Once it has opponents trapped in a tornado that could blow away a 10-ton truck, it finishes them off with its poisonous scales.

name: weedle
bio: Beware of the sharp stinger on its head. It hides in grass and bushes where it eats leaves.

name: kakuna
bio: Able to move only slightly. When endangered, it may stick out its stinger and poison its enemy.

name: beedrill
bio: Its legs have become poison stingers. It stabs its prey repeatedly with the stingers on its limbs, dealing the final blow with the stinger on its rear.

name: pidgey
bio: Very docile. If attacked, it will often kick up sand to protect itself rather than fight back.

name: pidgeotto
bio: This Pokémon is full of vitality. It constantly flies around its large territory in search of prey.

name: pidgeot
bio: This Pokémon flies at Mach 2 speed, seeking prey. Its large talons are feared as wicked weapons.

name: rattata
bio: Its whiskers provide it with a keen sense of smell, enabling it to pick up the scent of hidden food and locate it instantly.

name: raticate
bio: It makes its Rattata underlings gather food for it, dining solely on the most nutritious and delicious fare.

name: spearow
bio: Inept at flying high. However, it can fly around very fast to protect its territory.

name: fearow
bio: A Pokémon that dates back many years. If it senses danger, it flies high and away, instantly.

name: ekans
bio: The older it gets, the longer it grows. At night, it wraps its long body around tree branches to rest.

name: arbok
bio: The frightening patterns on its belly have been studied. Six variations have been confirmed.

name: pikachu
bio: When it smashes its opponents with its bolt-shaped tail, it delivers a surge of electricity equivalent to a lightning strike.

name: raichu
bio: This Pokémon rides on its tail while it uses its psychic powers to levitate. It attacks with star-shaped thunderbolts.

name: sandshrew
bio: It lives in snowy mountains on southern islands. When a blizzard rolls in, this Pokémon hunkers down in the snow to avoid getting blown away.

name: sandslash
bio: Many people climb snowy mountains, hoping to see the icy spikes of these Pokémon glistening in the light of dawn.

name: nidoran-f
bio: It uses its hard incisor teeth to crush and eat berries. The tip of a female Nidoran's horn is a bit more rounded than the tip of a male's horn.

name: nidorina
bio: If the group is threatened, these Pokémon will band together to assault enemies with a chorus of ultrasonic waves.

name: nidoqueen
bio: It pacifies offspring by placing them in the gaps between the spines on its back. The spines will never secrete poison while young are present.

name: nidoran-m
bio: Small but brave, this Pokémon will hold its ground and even risk its life in battle to protect the female it's friendly with.

name: nidorino
bio: It's nervous and quick to act aggressively. The potency of its poison increases along with the level of adrenaline present in its body.

name: nidoking
bio: Nidoking prides itself on its strength. It's forceful and spirited in battle, making use of its thick tail and diamond-crushing horn.

name: clefairy
bio: Its adorable behavior and cry make it highly popular. However, this cute Pokémon is rarely found.

name: clefable
bio: Their ears are sensitive enough to hear a pin drop from over a mile away, so they're usually found in quiet places.

name: vulpix
bio: If you observe its curly hairs through a microscope, you'll see small ice particles springing up.

name: ninetales
bio: While it will guide travelers who get lost on a snowy mountain down to the mountain's base, it won't forgive anyone who harms nature.

name: voltorb
bio: It is said to camouflage itself as a Poké Ball. It will self-destruct with very little stimulus.
